column4: how can I make the game "Where in the world is Carmen Sandiego?" work on ubuntu using dosbox?
how can I make the game "Where in the world is Carmen Sandiego?" work on ubuntu using dosbox?
use the terminal to run the install exe or bat
how do I do that?
you type: dosbox /path/to/the/setup.exe    replace the path bit with the actual path  needed, that example will not work
np
YOU ARE AWESOME!!!!
np, if you add -fullscreen (might be --fulscreen) it will go fullscreen
use dd to put it onto te usb
you put it on the disk too (e.g. /dev/sdb) and not the partition (e.g. /dev/sdb1)
if your usb device is a different dev, use its name, the command is: sudo dd if=imagefile.img of=/dev/sdb
you will need to point the command at te image file (you can use absolutes if you wish)
you can check the /dev/  entry with: sudo fdisk -l
fdisk -l does nothing
ok then run: sudo umount /dev/sdb1; sudo dd if=<image file here> of=/dev/sdb
you will need to replace <image file here> with the actual file with path
ok you downloaded the img file, yes
where is it and whats its name
is it by any chance on the desktop??
ok and what is the filename?
ubuntu-9.04-netbook-remix-i386(2).img
i'm going to pm you the output of sudo fdisk -l
sudo umount /dev/sdb1; sudo dd if=~/Desktop/ ubuntu-9.04-netbook-remix-i386\(2\).img of=/dev/sdb
you need the \s in the command as you have braces in the filename
